alert.note: Alert for Dearborn (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 12:24AM EST until February 26 at 11:42PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Southeast Indiana and Southwest Ohio, including the following counties, in Southeast Indiana, Dearborn, Franklin IN and Ripley. In Southwest Ohio, Butler, Clermont, Clinton, Hamilton and Warren. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1224 AM EST, local law enforcement reported flooding in the warned area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Cincinnati, Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Covington, Mason, Oxford, Lebanon, Norwood, Forest Park, Springboro, Fort Thomas, Sharonville, Wilmington, Monroe, Blue Ash, Loveland, Trenton, Franklin and Springdale.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
